stories.text:
Is there something like a Discourse forum to discuss programming projects that are not yet finished? Any Discord, Matrix, Zulip servers?

I tried Discord but the servers I joined had very hard divisions on the topics, "Showcase" channels had very strict rules and "General" channels went way too fast with no order. I didn't find any Discourse community for programming discussion that wasn't specific to a single project.

I recently finished a MVP and realized that the idea's execution wasn't good. I could've realized way earlier if I had asked for feedback but I don't have programmer friends nor I'm part of online communities.

I will start v2 of the same project and I'd like to discuss it as I'm developing. I'd also like to see other's people WIP projects.

Thanks in advance!
stories.title: Ask HN: Online comunities to discuss WIP programming projects (mine and others)?
Biden begins $6B program to bail out distressed nuclear power plants
Ukrainian Man Tracks Russian Troops with Stolen AirPods
Algo stablecoin that use financial engineering to maintain peg is dangerous
Netflix Will Face Hurdles in Courting Advertisers, but Biz Abuzz About New Model

stories.text:
What are some of the thinkers that greatly inspire or influence your work or your way of thinking in general? Or maybe the people you look up to, or aspire to be, etc.

And I mean "thinkers" in the broadest sense (eg writers, artists, bloggers, people in your field, etc.).

I think the HN crowd is super smart and would really love to learn about your influences!!

A list of multiple people (with explanations if you'd like) would be even better :)
stories.title: Ask HN: Thinkers that have greatly influenced your way of thinking?
HDD Areal Density Growth Slows as Capacity Increases
Biden administration will appeal ruling that lifted Covid mask mandate on travel
A Downtick Is Coming for Online Advertising
